description: Workflow-style slash commands using Playwright MCP for managing Slidev templates: sync-all, sync-template, add-template

key_decisions.rationale: Works better than Firecrawl, runs locally, no API key needed.
Prompts guide agents through dynamic iteration; more flexible than rigid scripts.
Single-purpose commands (sync-all, sync-template, add-template) are clearer than one command with many flags.
Keep it simple with three commands; validation can be part of sync.
Prompt for name, purpose, layout, animation pattern during creation.

key_decisions.decision: Use explicit metadata for click counts
key_decisions.rationale: clicks field in templates.json - simpler than auto-discovery.

key_decisions.decision: Screenshots in subfolder with sequential naming
key_decisions.rationale: Store in screenshots/ subfolder using click-0.png, click-1.png pattern. Keeps template folder clean.

high_level: Enable agents to understand slide storytelling through progressive screenshots showing layout, styling, and click-state progression
Self-maintaining template system - agents can sync screenshots and add new templates
Workflow-driven commands that guide agents through dynamic iteration
mid_level: /slidev:sync-all - iterate through templates.json, capture all screenshots
/slidev:sync-template - capture screenshots for a specific template
/slidev:add-template - full workflow for adding new templates
Slidev skill documenting structure and conventions
detailed: Template folders should have: description.md, example.md, slide.md, and screenshots/
